meanings.definition: To give a wrong title or name to something.
meanings.sent1: She mistitles the book as a mystery novel when it is actually a romance story.
meanings.sent2: He often mistitles his files, causing confusion in the office.
meanings.sent3: The librarian mistitles the biography as a science fiction book, much to the amusement of the readers.
meanings.sent4: The artist mistitles his painting 'Sunset' even though it clearly depicts a sunrise.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's habit of mistitling assignments makes it hard for students to find their work.

meanings.definition: To incorrectly label or identify something.
meanings.sent1: The museum curator mistitles the artifact, claiming it is from the Roman era when it is actually from the Greek period.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to mistitle products in the store to avoid customer confusion.
meanings.sent3: The detective mistitles the suspect as the culprit, leading to a humorous mix-up in the investigation.
meanings.sent4: The weather forecaster mistitles the storm as a hurricane, causing unnecessary panic among the residents.
meanings.sent5: The journalist must be careful not to mistitle individuals in their articles to maintain credibility.
